prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: Future star magician, and Phoenix Wright's daughter. Fond of her Mr. Hat trick.
Character 2
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Star prosecutor and leader/vocalist for the rock group, the Gavinners.
Character 3
Name: LeTouse
Description: Lamiroir's interpreter. His first name is "Romein".
Character 4
Name: Lamiroir
Description: Singer lauded as the "Siren of the Ballad", from the tiny country of Borginia.
Character 5
Name: Machi Tobaye
Description: Lamiroir's favorite pianist. He is blind.
Character 6
Name: Ema Skye
Description: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 7
Name: Daryan Crescend
Description: Guitarist for the Gavinners. His day job is as a detective in Criminal Affairs, Div. 3.
Character 8
Name: Valant Gramarye
Description: Famous magician, often on TV. Fond of exaggeration.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Postcard
Description: Lamiroir's own publicity postcard. Click here for details.
Evidence 2
Name: Lyrics Sheet
Description: Contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Investigation Request
Description: Information concerning the crime to be restricted to police and related parties.
Evidence 4
Name: Brooch
Description: Found at the crime scene. Seems strangely familiar... Found at the crime scene. Turns out it belongs to Lamiroir.
Evidence 5
Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon.  A deadly, high-caliber revolver. The murder weapon. A deadly, high-caliber revolver belonging to Mr. LeTouse.
Evidence 6
Name: Key Ring
Description: Mr. LeTouse died clutching this. Note the heart-shaped ring. Found in the victim's left hand. Holds keys to a guitar case and a motorcycle.
Evidence 7
Name: Mixing Board
Description: Allows music to be played in separate tracks. Click here to use.
Evidence 8
Name: LeTouse's Autopsy Report
Description: Death due to loss of blood from a gunshot wound. Est. time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: Victim shot in shoulder in Lamiroir's room. [caption] The victim was lying head down on the floor, his face turned to the left. There is smeared writing in blood on the floor in front of his head next to his right hand.
Evidence 10
Name: Diagram
Description: The crime scene was Lamiroir's dressing room. [caption] Observing from the door, the victim was blocked from sight by items. There was a gun next to the victim's body. Two bullet holes were found on the wall where the door was.
I... looked into the room. Just a glance, mind you.
Evidence 11
Name: Video Tape
Description: Taped recording of Lamiroir's performance. Click here for details.
Evidence 12
Name: Headset
Description: Retrieved from Backstage Hallway. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals. All concert staff wore one. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals with a 30-foot range. All concert staff wore one.
Evidence 13
Name: Switch → Remote Trigger
Description: Found on the stage. It's a switch for something, and that's about all I know. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter. Use with caution. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter within 30 feet.
Evidence 14
Name: Forum Diagram
Description: Cross-section diagram of the Sunshine Coliseum. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Igniter
Description: Found at the crime scene. Emits a flame when triggered by remote control. Identical igniters in Gavin's guitar and at the crime scene. Triggered by "Remote Trigger".
Evidence 16
Name: Borginian Newspaper
Description: Article about the case. It doesn't mention the lyrics of Lamiroir's ballad.
Evidence 17
Name: Prosecutor Gavin's Guitar
Description: A gift from Lamiroir, sent from Borginia. Burned the night of the concert.
Evidence 18
Name: Replica
Description: Replica of something, held by Mr. LeTouse. Apparently the focus of his investigation. Borginia Cocoon replica, held by Mr. LeTouse. Replica of a cocoon from which a remedy for "incuritis" may be extracted.
Evidence 19
Name: Newspaper Article
Description: Article about the Chief Justice's son, who is inflicted with "incuritis".
Evidence 20
Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: Found at the crime scene, bearing a gunpowder residue. Possibly a firecracker?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As for what I saw... I saw nothing.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 1
Testimony: That night, I was invited to sing on stage, and this I did.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 2
Testimony: I did not return backstage after the second set.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 3
Testimony: When my performance was finished, I went backstage for just a moment...
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 4
Testimony: I saw nothing. The late Mr. LeTouse's body was behind a wall.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 5
Testimony: I saw bullet holes in the wall, and knew Mr. LeTouse had been shot...
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 6
Testimony: Then I was led by the police to Mr. Gavin's dressing room, and told to wait there.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 7
Testimony: That was where I learned that something had happened... But I wasn't told the details.
Person: Lamiroir

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the scenario.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. Phoenix Wright is the defense attorney, and the victim is LeTouse, who was shot. Lamiroir is a key witness and the singer who was performing that night. There's also Klavier Gavin, the prosecutor, and other characters like Machi Tobaye, the pianist, and Daryan Crescend, a detective and guitarist.

Now, let's examine the evidence and testimonies provided.

Evidence 4 is a brooch found at the crime scene, which belongs to Lamiroir. Evidence 5 is the revolver used in the murder, which belonged to LeTouse. The crime photo (Evidence 9) shows the victim shot in the shoulder, lying in Lamiroir's dressing room with blood and bullet holes on the wall.

Looking at the testimonies, Lamiroir claims she didn't see anything (Testimony 0), performed on stage (Testimony 1), didn't return backstage after the second set (Testimony 2), only went backstage for a moment after her performance (Testimony 3), and saw nothing because the victim was behind a wall (Testimony 4). She also mentions seeing bullet holes but didn't know the details (Testimony 5-7).

Now, focusing on possible contradictions. The crime photo (Evidence 9) shows the victim lying in the dressing room with blood and bullet holes. Lamiroir's testimony claims she saw nothing and didn't return backstage after her performance. However, if the crime occurred in her dressing room, it's unlikely she wouldn't have seen anything, especially since she was backstage at some point.

But wait, the key contradiction might be elsewhere. Let's check other evidence. The revolver (Evidence 5) was found at the scene, belonging to LeTouse. However, the testimony doesn't mention the gun, which could be a point of contradiction if the witness claimed the victim wasn't armed.

Alternatively, considering the brooch (Evidence 4), which belongs to Lamiroir, found at the crime scene, and her testimony that she didn't see anything, there might be a contradiction if her presence at the scene isn't explained.

However, the most direct contradiction seems to be between the crime photo (Evidence 9) and Lamiroir's testimony (Testimony 4). The crime photo shows the victim's body in her dressing room, which she claims to have visited but saw nothing. This suggests she might be withholding information or not telling the whole truth.

But wait, looking again, the crime photo is in her dressing room, and she claims she didn't see anything because the victim was behind a wall. This could imply that the layout of the room as per the crime photo might not align with her testimony about not seeing the body.

Alternatively, considering the revolver (Evidence 5) and her testimony about not seeing the gun, there might be a contradiction if the revolver's presence isn't accounted for in her testimony.

After reviewing, the most significant contradiction is between the crime photo (showing the victim in her dressing room) and Lamiroir's claim that she didn't see anything, suggesting she might have seen more than she's letting on.
</think>

{"evidence": 9, "testimony": 4}

response:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I'm a bit new to this, so I'll take it step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Phoenix Wright, Trucy Wright, Klavier Gavin, LeTouse, Lamiroir, Machi Tobaye, Ema Skye, Daryan Crescend, and Valant Gramarye. The case seems to revolve around a murder, and the main suspect is Machi Tobaye, who is blind.

Now, let's look at the evidences. There's a lot here, but a few stand out. Evidence 5 is a revolver, the murder weapon, which belongs to LeTouse. Evidence 9 is the crime photo showing the victim shot in the shoulder, with some smeared writing in blood. Evidence 15 is an igniter found at the crime scene, which is triggered by a remote switch (Evidence 13). Evidence 17 is Klavier Gavin's guitar, which was burned the night of the concert.

Looking at the testimonies, Ema Skye testifies that she believes Machi stole the body because of some lyrics (Testimony 0), that he moved the body to match Lamiroir's song (Testimony 1), and that no one in the country had a motive to kill the victim (Testimony 2). She also mentions that all evidence points to the defendant (Testimony 4) and concludes the shooter was blind (Testimony 5).

Now, I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. Let's see:

Ema says the shooter was blind (Testimony 5), implying Machi, who is blind, did it. However, Evidence 9 shows the victim was shot in the shoulder, and there's smeared writing in blood. If Machi is blind, how did he manage to shoot the victim so precisely? Also, Evidence 15 and 13 suggest a remote trigger was used, which might indicate a different method than a blind person shooting directly.

So, the testimony that the shooter was blind (Testimony 5) contradicts the evidence showing the shooter used a remote trigger (Evidence 15 and 13), which doesn't require sight. Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 15 and Testimony 5.
</think>

{"evidence": 15, "testimony": 5}
